references.reason: This paper introduces a new distribution-free quantile estimator, which is used as a smooth quantile estimator in this paper's proposed method to enhance its differentiability and improve its optimization performance.
This book provides the theoretical foundation for the gradient boosting optimization technique used in the proposed method, which requires a differentiable loss function for effective optimization.
This paper introduces the concept of conformal prediction, which is the basis of the proposed boosted conformal prediction intervals.
This paper proposes a locally adaptive conformal prediction method that serves as a baseline for the proposed boosted conformal prediction intervals.

This paper introduces conformalized quantile regression, which provides another baseline for the proposed boosted conformal prediction intervals, and it is compared in this paper to demonstrate the improvement achieved.
